summary: Mondelez International is an American food and snack company based in Chicago. It was originally part of Kraft Foods, which was founded in 1923. In 2012, Kraft Foods changed its name to Mondelez and focused on snacks. The company makes many popular treats like Oreo cookies, Cadbury chocolate, and Trident gum. It operates in over 160 countries and makes about $26.5 billion each year. Mondelez also owns brands in Canada, like Mr. Christie cookies.
title: Mondelez International
